thread.title: Tyreke Evans undergoes knee surgery, sidelined indefinitely
thread.title_full: Tyreke Evans undergoes knee surgery, sidelined indefinitely

author: customerservice@sportingnews.com (Gabrielle McMillen)
title: Tyreke Evans undergoes knee surgery, sidelined indefinitely
text:
Tyreke Evans undergoes knee surgery, sidelined indefinitely Sporting News 5 hrs ago customerservice@sportingnews.com (Gabrielle McMillen) Â© Logan Bowles-USA TODAY Sports Hawks guard Kent Bazemore defends Pelicans guard Tyreke Evans during the third quarter of an Oct. 9 exhibition game at Veterans Memorial Arena. Pelicans guard Tyreke Evans underwent arthroscopic surgery on his right knee Tuesday morning, the team announced .
AdChoices It's the second surgery on Evans' knee following an initial procedure in May and there is no timetable for his return. He complained of soreness on Friday, which led to team doctors checking out his knee.
MORE: Every NBA teams' greatest strength this season | Best fantasy basketball team names
Evans originally sat out during the Pelicans' first preseason game due to a right knee contusion. He appeared in two games Oct. 9 and Oct. 12, logging 24 minutes in each, but missed Saturday's game against the Kings.
Evans' injury comes at a bad time for New Orleans, which is also missing centers Omer Asik and Alexis Ajinca and guard. Jrue Holiday will also begin the season on a minutes limit.
Evans said a healthy Pelicans team is no different than the champion Warriors, but his goal of winning the 2015-16 championship seems a bit far fetched right now.
